New Records: Tyler O'Neill hit his 27th home run this season and his 11th career multihomer game, his sixth this year.
Key Match Events: Tyler O'Neill homered twice for the Boston Red Sox in a 7-5 win against the Chicago White Sox.
Andrew Vaughn hit a two-run homer in the first for the White Sox.
Andrew Benintendi hit a three-run homer in the seventh against the White Sox.
Kenley Jansen got three straight outs on seven pitches for his 26th save in 30 chances.
Pre-Game Insights: Trevor Story was returning from a shoulder injury that required surgery and caused him to miss 133 games.
Post-Match Reflections: Boston won its second straight game after a five-game losing streak and trails Minnesota for the AL's final wild card berth.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox are nine defeats shy of tying the 1962 New York Mets for the most losses since 1900 and are on pace to finish 36-126.
Boston improved to 35-13 when wearing its yellow alternate jerseys, including 20-9 since the start of 2023 and 8-6 this season.
Others: RHP Isaiah Campbell was recalled from Worcester and placed on the 60-day Injured list with right elbow inflammation.
INF Mickey Gaspar was optioned to Triple-A Worcester to make room for Trevor Story on the active roster.
